sources.title: The Hideous Sun Demon (1958)
sources.description: The Hideous Sun Demon is a 1958 American science fiction horror film. It was produced, directed, and co-written by Robert Clarke, who also stars in the lead role. The story follows Dr. Gilbert "Gil" McKenna, a research scientist who, after being exposed to a radioactive isotope, transforms into a lizard-like creature whenever he is exposed to sunlight. This transformation leads to horrifying consequences, including violent behavior. The film explores themes of isolation and the struggle with one's darker nature.

metadata.Plot: A scientist, Gilbert McKenna has an accident where he is exposed to high levels of radiation. Surprisingly this does not kill him but instead leaves him unable to be exposed to sunlight. Whenever exposed to sunlight, McKenna devolves into a lizard man with homicidal tendencies. After having a brief fling with a nightclub singer, and killing her boyfriend, McKenna is on the lam from the police which culminates in a one on one battle on top of a tower. Great monster costume and Shatner type acting from Clarke are the most memorable parts of this great 1950s creature feature.
metadata.Writer: E.S. Seeley Jr., Doane R. Hoag, Robert Clarke
metadata.Actors: Robert Clarke, Patricia Manning, Nan Peterson
